intro: Leucosidea sericea, commonly known as the silky leucosidea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Leucosidea sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
